com.ericdaugherty.lib.error
Class CascadingException

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Throwable
        |
        +--java.lang.Exception
              |
              +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.error.CascadingException
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
BusinessException, SystemException
public abstract class CascadingException
extends java.lang.Exception
implements java.io.Serializable

Provides the base functionality for all Exception classes defined in the error package. This class is abstract and should not be used directly. Instead, please use either BusinessException, SystemException, or one of the classes that extend those exceptions.

This class provides two major functions, the ability to cascade exceptions, and the ability to easily format and print exceptions. CascadingException exposes several constructors that can be overloaded in subclasses. These constructors take a variety of parameters, but one important parameter is java.lang.Exception. If an exception is passed to this constructor it is captured as a private variable. When the printStackTrace() method is called, CascadingException not only prints its own stack trace, but also prints out the stack trace of the captured exception. This behavior is recursive, and there is no limit on the length of the 'cascade'. However, it is not recommended to cascade more than 2 levels deep. Additionally, the getStackTrace() method has been added to return the stack trace as a string.

This class also provides 'advanced' message formatting.

MessageFormat
Error messages can be formatted using the MessageFormat class. The constructors have been overloaded to accept an array of Objects. If this parameter is set, the message will be parsed using the MessageFormat class, and the specified Object array.

This exception is currently written using JDK 1.3.1. JDK 1.4 provides some of the same functionality provided here. When JDK 1.4 becomes widely accepted, this class will be modified to utilize the new functionality provided by JDK 1.4. However, the changes should only effect the implementation of this class, and not its interface. This class will continue to provide functionality not provided in the 1.4 exception class, and will continue to be the base class for all Exceptions in this package.

For more information about the error package, please refer to the package level documentation.

Author:
Eric Daugherty (http://www.ericdaugherty.com/java/daughertylib)

Also accepts an Object array for use in formatting the message using the MessageFormat class.

messageObjects - objects used to format the msg String.

Method Detail

getNestedException

public java.lang.Throwable getNestedException()
Provides access to the nested exception stored in this Exception.
Returns:
the nestedException that was passeed to this class in the constructor, or null if none exists.

getStackTraceString

public java.lang.String getStackTraceString()
Iderates through all the nested CascadingExceptions to genrate the entire stack trace for the entire tree.

The resulting stack trace will contain the stack trace from the 'deepest' exception first. The last stack trace displayed will be the stack trace for this exception.

Returns:
String containing the stack trace of the entire cascade of exceptions.

getMessage

public java.lang.String getMessage()
Overrides the Exception.getMessage() method to include the Exception message information from the nested exception.
Overrides:
getMessage in class java.lang.Throwable
Returns:
the Exception message from this exception and the nested exception.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides the Exception.toString() method to include the nested exception's toString output.
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Throwable
Returns:
the toString message from this exception and the nested exception.

public void printStackTrace()
